request.description:
### Auth/Login

This endpoint is used to authenticate and login a user.

**Request Body**

- email (string): The email of the user.
    
- password (string): The password of the user.

### User Registration

This endpoint is used to register a new user.

**Request Body**

- name (string): The name of the user.
    
- surname (string): The surname of the user.
    
- password (string): The password for the user account.
    
- age (number): The age of the user.
    
- email (string): The email address of the user.
    
- registerDate (string): The registration date of the user.
    
- role (string): The role of the user.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve community messages from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

### Response

The response body includes an array of message objects, each containing the following properties:

- "messageID": The unique identifier of the message.
    
- "userID": The unique identifier of the user who posted the message.
    
- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game associated with the message.
    
- "message": The content of the message.
    
- "publicationDate": The date and time when the message was published.
    
- "edited": A boolean indicating whether the message has been edited.
    
- "likesCount": The count of likes received for the message.

request.description:
### Community Post

This endpoint is used to create a new post in the community.

**Request Body**

- message (string): The message content of the post.
    
- publicationDate (string): The date of publication of the post.
    
- likesCount (number): The count of likes on the post.
    
- gameID (number): The ID of the game associated with the post.
    
- userID (number): The ID of the user creating the post.

This endpoint makes an HTTP PUT request to update the ticket information for a specific ticket in the community with ID 3. The request body should include the "message" field with the updated ticket information.

### Response

The response of this request can be documented as a JSON schema. It includes the schema definition for the properties returned in the response, such as ticket ID, updated ticketRow, updated ticketColumn, updated price, and updated scheduleTicket.

### Delete Ticket

This endpoint is used to delete a specific ticket.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- Endpoint: `{{dominio}}/Community/3`
    
- Description: This request deletes a specific ticket from the community.

### Retrieve Community Message

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a community message from the specified URL.

#### Request

This is a GET request and does not contain a request body.

#### Response

The response body is a JSON object with the following properties:

- "messageID" (number): The unique identifier of the message.
    
- "userID" (number): The unique identifier of the user who posted the message.
    
- "gameID" (number): The unique identifier of the game associated with the message.
    
- "message" (string): The content of the message.
    
- "publicationDate" (string): The date of publication of the message.
    
- "edited" (boolean): Indicates if the message has been edited.
    
- "likesCount" (number): The count of likes received for the message.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve game information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

### Response

The response body includes an array of game objects, each containing the following properties:

- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game.
    
- "name": The name of the game.
    
- "description": The description of the game.
    
- "synopsis": The synopsis of the game.
    
- "price": The price of the game.
    
- "discount": The discount on the game.
    
- "releaseDate": The release date of the game.
    
- "categories": The categories associated with the game.
    
- "messages": An array of message objects containing the following properties:
    
    - "messageID": The unique identifier of the message.
        
    - "userID": The unique identifier of the user who posted the message.
        
    - "gameID": The unique identifier of the game associated with the message.
        
    - "message": The content of the message.
        
    - "publicationDate": The date of publication of the message.
        
    - "edited": Indicates if the message has been edited.
        
    - "likesCount": The count of likes on the message.
        
- "studioID": The unique identifier of the studio associated with the game.

request.description:
### Game Creation

This endpoint is used to create a new game.

**Request Body**

- name (string): The name of the game.
    
- description (string): The description of the game.
    
- synopsis (string): The synopsis of the game.
    
- price (number): The price of the game.
    
- discount (number): The discount on the game.
    
- releaseDate (string): The release date of the game.
    
- categories (string): The categories of the game.
    
- studioID (number): The ID of the studio.
    
- storeID (number): The ID of the store.

### Update Game Information

This endpoint is used to update the information for a specific game with the given ID.

#### Request Body

The request should include a JSON payload with the following key:

- `discount` (number): The discount value for the game.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "discount": 0
}

 ```

### Delete Game

This endpoint is used to delete a specific game.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- Endpoint: `{{dominio}}/Game/3`

### Retrieve Game Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve information about a specific game from the specified URL.

#### Request

The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request. The endpoint URL should include the game ID in the path parameter.

`GET {{dominio}}Game/1`

#### Response

The response body includes details about the game, such as:

- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game.
    
- "name": The name of the game.
    
- "description": The description of the game.
    
- "synopsis": The synopsis of the game.
    
- "price": The price of the game.
    
- "discount": The discount on the game.
    
- "releaseDate": The release date of the game.
    
- "categories": The categories associated with the game.
    
- "messages": An array of messages related to the game, each containing properties like "messageID", "userID", "gameID", "message", "publicationDate", "edited", and "likesCount".
    
- "studioID": The unique identifier of the studio associated with the game.

request.description:
### Retrieve GameShop Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve GameShop information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Response

The response body includes an array of GameShop objects, each containing the following properties:

- "storeID": The unique identifier of the GameShop store.
    
- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game available at the GameShop.
    
- "event": Details of any event associated with the GameShop.
    
- "annualSales": The annual sales figure of the GameShop.
    
- "lastUpdated": Timestamp indicating when the information was last updated.
    
- "origin": The origin or source of the GameShop.
    
- "location": The location of the GameShop.
    
- "contactNumber": The contact number of the GameShop.
    
- "email": The email address of the GameShop.

request.description:
### Create New GameShop

This endpoint is used to create a new gameshop.

**Request Body**

- price (number): The price of the ticket.
    
- event (string): The event for the ticket.
    
- annualSales (number): The annual sales for the ticket.
    
- lastUpdated (string): The last updated date for the ticket.
    
- origin (string): The origin of the ticket.
    
- location (string): The location of the ticket.
    
- contactNumber (string): The contact number for the ticket.
    
- email (string): The email for the ticket.

### Update GameShop Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP PUT request to update the gameshop information for a specific gameshop with ID 1.

#### Request Body

- event (string, required): Specify the event to be updated.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "event": "example_event"
}

 ```

### Retrieve Game Shop Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve game shop information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Response

The response body returns an object with the following properties:

- "storeID": The unique identifier of the game shop.
    
- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game available at the shop.
    
- "event": Details about any ongoing event at the shop.
    
- "annualSales": The annual sales of the game shop.
    
- "lastUpdated": Timestamp of the last update to the information.
    
- "origin": The origin of the game available at the shop.
    
- "location": The location of the game shop.
    
- "contactNumber": The contact number of the game shop.
    
- "email": The email address of the game shop.
    

#### JSON Schema

``` json
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "storeID": {"type": "number"},
        "gameID": {"type": "number"},
        "event": {"type": "string"},
        "annualSales": {"type": "number"},
        "lastUpdated": {"type": "string", "format": "date-time"},
        "origin": {"type": "string"},
        "location": {"type": "string"},
        "contactNumber": {"type": "string"},
        "email": {"type": "string", "format": "email"}
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve game information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request. The response body includes an array of game objects, each containing the following properties:

- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game.
    
- "name": The name of the game.
    
- "description": The detailed description of the game.
    
- "synopsis": A brief synopsis of the game.
    
- "price": The price of the game.
    
- "discount": The discount applied to the game.
    
- "releaseDate": The release date of the game.
    
- "categories": The categories or genres the game belongs to.
    
- "messages": Any additional messages related to the game.
    
- "studioID": The unique identifier of the studio associated with the game.
    

### Response JSON Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "array",
  "items": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "gameID": { "type": "number" },
      "name": { "type": "string" },
      "description": { "type": "string" },
      "synopsis": { "type": "string" },
      "price": { "type": "number" },
      "discount": { "type": "number" },
      "releaseDate": { "type": "string" },
      "categories": { "type": "string" },
      "messages": { "type": ["null", "string"] },
      "studioID": { "type": "number" }
    }
  }
}

 ```

item.name: LibraryGameUser

request.description:
### Retrieve Ticket Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve ticket information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Request

No request body is required for this GET request.

#### Response

The response body is a JSON array of ticket objects, each containing the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the ticket.
    
- `ticketRow` (number): The row number of the ticket.
    
- `ticketColumn` (number): The column number of the ticket.
    
- `price` (number): The price of the ticket.
    
- `scheduleTicket` (object): The schedule information related to the ticket.
    
- `userId` (string): The unique identifier of the user associated with the ticket.
    
- `playId` (string): The unique identifier of the play associated with the ticket.
    

#### JSON Schema for Response

``` json
{
  "type": "array",
  "items": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "id": { "type": "string" },
      "ticketRow": { "type": "number" },
      "ticketColumn": { "type": "number" },
      "price": { "type": "number" },
      "scheduleTicket": { "type": "object" },
      "userId": { "type": "string" },
      "playId": { "type": "string" }
    }
  }
}

 ```

### Library Game User Creation

This endpoint is used to create a new library game user.

**Request Body**

- addedDate (string): The date when the game was added to the library.
    
- rating (number): The rating given to the game.
    
- hoursPlayed (number): The total hours played.
    
- lastPlayed (string): The date when the game was last played.
    
- userID (number): The ID of the user.
This endpoint makes an HTTP PUT request to update the game user information for a specific user with ID 1. The request body should include the "rating" field with the updated value.

The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

### Create Shopping Cart

- fechaCreacion (string): The date of creation of the shopping cart.

### PUT {{dominio}}ShoppingCart/1

item.name: Studio

request.description:
### Retrieve Studio Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve studio information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Response
The response body is an array of studio objects, each containing the following properties:

- "studioID": The unique identifier of the studio.
- "name": The name of the studio.
- "fundation": The foundation date of the studio.
- "country": The country where the studio is located.
- "emailContact": The contact email of the studio.
- "emailLogin": The login email of the studio.
- "password": The password of the studio.
- "website": The website of the studio.
- "games": An array of game objects, each containing:
  - "gameID": The unique identifier of the game.
  - "name": The name of the game.
  - "description": The description of the game.
  - "synopsis": The synopsis of the game.
  - "price": The price of the game.
  - "discount": The discount on the game.
  - "releaseDate": The release date of the game.
  - "categories": The categories of the game.
  - "messages": Messages related to the game.
  - "studioID": The unique identifier of the studio associated with the game.

#### JSON Schema
```json
{
  "type": "array",
  "items": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "studioID": { "type": "number" },
      "name": { "type": "string" },
      "fundation": { "type": "string" },
      "country": { "type": "string" },
      "emailContact": { "type": "string" },
      "emailLogin": { "type": "string" },
      "password": { "type": "string" },
      "website": { "type": "string" },
      "games": {
        "type": "array",
        "items": {
          "type": "object",
          "properties": {
            "gameID": { "type": "number" },
            "name": { "type": "string" },
            "description": { "type": "string" },
            "synopsis": { "type": "string" },
            "price": { "type": "number" },
            "discount": { "type": "number" },
            "releaseDate": { "type": "string" },
            "categories": { "type": "string" },
            "messages": { "type": "null" },
            "studioID": { "type": "number" }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

request.description:
### Studio Studio Creation

This endpoint is used to create a new Studio.

**Request Body**

- name (string): The name of the ticket.
    
- fundation (string): The foundation of the ticket.
    
- country (string): The country of the ticket.
    
- emailContact (string): The contact email for the ticket.
    
- emailLogin (string): The login email for the ticket.
    
- password (string): The password for the ticket.
    
- website (string): The website for the ticket.

### Update Studio Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP PUT request to update the Studio information for a specific Studio.

### Retrieve Studio Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve studio information from the specified URL.

#### Request

The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Response

The response body includes an array of studio objects, each containing the following properties:

- "studioID": The unique identifier of the studio.
    
- "name": The name of the studio.
    
- "fundation": The foundation date of the studio.
    
- "country": The country where the studio is located.
    
- "emailContact": The contact email of the studio.
    
- "emailLogin": The login email of the studio.

request.description:
### Retrieve User Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve user information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Response
The response body is an array of user objects, each containing the following properties:

- "userID": The unique identifier of the user.
- "name": The user's name.
- "surname": The user's surname.
- "password": The user's password.
- "age": The user's age.
- "email": The user's email address.
- "registerDate": The date of user registration.
- "messages": An array of messages associated with the user.
- "role": The role of the user.

#### JSON Schema
```json
{
  "type": "array",
  "items": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "userID": { "type": "integer" },
      "name": { "type": "string" },
      "surname": { "type": "string" },
      "password": { "type": "string" },
      "age": { "type": "integer" },
      "email": { "type": "string" },
      "registerDate": { "type": "string", "format": "date-time" },
      "messages": { "type": "array" },
      "role": { "type": "string" }
    }
  }
}
```

### User Creation

This endpoint is used to create a new user.

**Request Body**

- name (string): The name of the user.
    
- surname (string): The surname of the user.
    
- password (string): The password for the user.
    
- age (number): The age of the user.
    
- email (string): The email address of the user.
    
- registerDate (string): The registration date of the user.
    
- role (string): The role of the user.

### Retrieve User Information

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve user information from the specified URL. The request does not contain a request body as it is a GET request.

#### Response
The response body is a JSON object representing the user information with the following properties:

- "userID": The unique identifier of the user.
- "name": The name of the user.
- "surname": The surname of the user.
- "password": The password of the user.
- "age": The age of the user.
- "email": The email address of the user.
- "registerDate": The date of user registration.
- "messages": An array of messages associated with the user.
- "role": The role of the user.

```json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "userID": { "type": "number" },
    "name": { "type": "string" },
    "surname": { "type": "string" },
    "password": { "type": "string" },
    "age": { "type": "number" },
    "email": { "type": "string" },
    "registerDate": { "type": "string", "format": "date-time" },
    "messages": { "type": "array" },
    "role": { "type": "string" }
  }
}
```

### Retrieve User Messages

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve messages for a specific user from the specified URL.

#### Request

- Method: `GET`
- URL: `{{dominio}}/User/2/messages`

#### Response

The response body includes an array of message objects, each containing the following properties:

- "messageID": The unique identifier of the message.
- "userID": The unique identifier of the user associated with the message.
- "gameID": The unique identifier of the game associated with the message.
- "message": The content of the message.
- "publicationDate": The date when the message was published.
- "edited": Indicates whether the message has been edited.
- "likesCount": The count of likes received for the message.

Example response:
```json
[{"messageID":0,"userID":0,"gameID":0,"message":"","publicationDate":"","edited":true,"likesCount":0}]
```
